StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Analysis of the Whole Transcriptomes of Human Testis with Complete Spermatogenesis and of Human Testes with Sertoli Cell-Only Syndrome

Person.Organization: WEILL MEDICAL COLL OF CORNELL UNIV

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Peter N. Schlegel, M.D. and Darius A. Paduch, M.D., Ph.D. (Department of Urology, Weill Cornell Medical College), collected testis biopsies as part of standard care during micro-TESE extraction of sperm from testicular tissue. Samples were stored in liquid nitrogen in the Department of Urology, Weill Cornell Medical College human testis repository. Stephanie Hilz (Department of Molecular Biology and Genetics, Cornell University) performed RNAseq analysis. The tissue repository and the analysis of these samples were supported by Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute for Child Health and Human Development, National Centers for Translational Research in Reproduction and Infertility Program (NCTRI) grants 1R01HD074542 and P50HD076210. Additional support was provided by NICHD grant R01 HD076412-02, the Robert Dow Foundation, the Frederick & Theresa Dow Wallace Fund of the New York Community Trust and the Brady Urological Foundation.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Male Infertility, IRB, PUB, COL)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-MINF-IRB-PUB-COL
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Male Infertility. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s).
